page.title: 16EARLS BARTON - SOCIETY
page.content: Until 1970,Earls Barton appeared a very fragmented community.New-comers and old families made an "us and Them" situation.The Vicar saw 1970 as the anniversary of the building of the church tower (1000 years) and organised with his parishioners the "Millenium" Festival which united the village and led to the development of many clubs and societies:Local History,Amateur Theatre,Music,Luncheon Clubs(which provide meals for those who normally eat alone),Youth clubs,Chess club,and other Sporting Clubs.There are groups linked to the various churches and several uniformed groups for children. The village tradition of eating Leek Pies is continued in annual Leek Pie Suppers. The fragmented society of the sixties has grown into a well organised community.
